# Cascade Operatives
[color=#999999][italic]"OPERATIVES STANDBY. YOUR OBJECTIVES ARE SIMPLE.[/italic][/color]
[color=#999999][italic]LOCATE OVERSEER'S OVERRIDE. PROTECT DELAMINATOR. STERILIZE PLANET UTILIZING ARTIFACT. BEGIN OPERATION."[/italic][/color]
You've just been chosen to be a cascade operative for [color=#ADD8E6]Nanotrasen[/color]. You have one goal, deal with Trieste Port.
## Operatives Your team will be made up of several different roles, which are: - [bold]Operatives[/bold], standard soldiers who can take up the grunt work. - The [bold]Corpsman[/bold] who works with reagents to make medicines or chemical weapons. - The [bold]Commander[/bold] who draws up the plan and leads the team.
If you have been selected as the Corpsman or Commander but don't feel ready, one of your teammates can take over your responsibilities.
## The Disk
Each operative starts with a [color=cyan]pinpointer[/color], which you should turn on and keep with you at all times. It will always point to the [color=cyan]Artifact Override Codes.[/color] The codes are stored on a disk which belongs to the [color=yellow]Overseer[/color], who will almost always have it on them. Follow the direction of the arrow on the pinpointer to the disk, and [italic]do whatever it takes to get it[/italic].
## Preparation Each member in your squad has been given an [color=cyan]uplink[/color] to purchase everything you will need for the mission, similar to [textlink="traitors." link="Traitors"]
You can purchase the same kinds of gear traitors can, but you have higher quality gear available to you and more bluespace crystals to spend.
You'll also have to choose if you want to [color=red]declare war[/color] or not. Doing so grants your team [bold]40 extra bluespace crystals each[/bold]. However, the citizens will immediately know of your existence and will have plenty of time to prepare for your arrival.
The [bold]Commander[/bold] is the only person who can declare war. Make your choice quick, [italic]this is a limited-time offer![/italic]
## Getting to the Platform You've got the plan, you've got the gear. Now, execute.
Your landing area will be the generally uninhabited Waste Zone. Prepare to move fast post-splashdown.
When everyone is ready, FTL to the planet and touch down on the surface. Your pinpointers and delaminator.
## The Artifact & Arming Procedure You have a device called the [color=cyan]Resonance Delaminator[/color] on your ship. This device is used the re-arm the Artifact's primary function:
[color=red]destroying planets.[/color]
- Obtain the [bold]Override Codes[/bold] - Move to Sweetwater, locate [color=purple]The Artifact[/color] - Insert the [bold]Override Codes[/bold] and [bold]Resonance Delaminator[/bold] - The [color=red]arming sequence[/color] will begin automatically - Protect The Artifact. Prevent the citizens from disarming it once more. - It takes 30 seconds for someone to [bold]disarm[/bold] the Artifact. Re-arming it is possible, but the chance of mission success drops if you let it happen.
## Winning Conditions
The [color=#00ff00]victor[/color] of the round is announced on the round end screen, as well as the scale of their victory.
[bold][color=blue]Syndicate Major Victory![/color][/bold] - The Artifact detonates, destroying the planet. - The citizens escapes on evac, but the Artifact is still armed. - The Artifact is armed and delivered to SolGov on the evac shuttle.
[bold][color=blue]Nanotrasen Minor Victory[/color][/bold] - The citizens escape on evac, but every operative survives. - The citizens escape and some operatives die, but the citizens lose the codes.
[bold][color=green]Citizen Minor Victory[/color][/bold] - The citizens escape on evac with the codes and some operatives die.
[bold][color=green]Citizen Major Victory![/color][/bold] - All operatives are killed.
